oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tornado damage to a house on RoEllen Road, Newbern
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tornado damage to a house on RoEllen Road, Newbern. Trees are damaged and uprooted. The top of the house is gone.

March 23, 1952, several tornadoes ran through the South East, affecting Alabama, Arkansas, Kentucky, Mississippi, Missouri, West Tennessee and part of Middle Tennessee. This resulted in a total of 246 known deaths across the six states, 63 of which were from Tennessee, and 16 of which were from Dyer County. Dyer County, TN estimated 60 homes destroyed, 65-70 homes damaged, and 125 farm buildings destroyed or damaged.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tornadoes; Disasters; Trees; Houses; Dwellings
